popt4jlib.EA

Class IntVarArray1MoveMaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.EA.IntVarArray1MoveMaker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NewChromosomeMakerIntf

    public class IntVarArray1MoveMaker
extends java.lang.Object
implements NewChromosomeMakerIntf
    class implements the NewChromosomeMakerIntf for chromosomes that are int[] objects of variable length.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:

    • Method Detail

      • createNewChromosome

        public java.lang.Object createNewChromosome(java.lang.Object chromosome,
                                   java.util.Hashtable params)
                                     throws OptimizerException
        create and return a int[] object that will represent a random "move" from the current chromosome argument passed in as first argument. The parameters passed in the second argument are as follows:
      • <"dea.movesigma", Double v> optional, the &delta value to use as &sigma when determining the distance to move in each dimension. Default is 1.0.
      • <"dea.movesigma$i$", Double v> optional, the &delta value to use as &sigma when determining the distance to move in the i-th dimension. Default is null.
      • <"dea.minallelevalue", Integer v> optional, the min. value that any component of the returned vector may assume.
      • <"dea.maxallelevalue", Integer v> optional, the max. value that any component of the returned vector may assume.
      • <"dea.minallelevalue"+$i$, Integer v> optional, the min value that the i-th comp. of the returned vector may assume (i={0,1,...nd.intValue()-1})
      • <"dea.maxallelevalue"+$i$, Integer v> optional, the max value that the i-th comp. of the returned vector may assume (i={0,1,...nd.intValue()-1})
        The "local" constraints can only impose more strict constraints on the variables, but cannot be used to "over-ride" a global constraint to make the domain of the variable wider.

        Notice that the &sigma values are used in determining the variance of the Gaussian distribution from which the random distance measures are computed along each dimension. Double computations are finally rounded into the nearest integer value when setting the values of the array that is returned.

Specified by:
createNewChromosome in interface NewChromosomeMakerIntf
Parameters:
chromosome - Object must be an int[]
params - Hashtable
Returns:
Object int[]
Throws:
OptimizerException - if any of the parameters are not passed in properly
